intro: Helicteres chapadensis, commonly known as the Brazilian candlewood, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Helicteres chapadensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical regions.
